relation: Auburn, ALAuburn Foster led team to an 11-2 record while collecting 80 tackles, nine for loss, five sacks and a forced fumble.
Autauga, ALAutauga Academy Despite missing four games because of a knee injury, Howard still had 12 touchdown receptions this season.
Muscle Shoals, ALMuscle Shoals Liner registered 79 tackles, 14 for loss with four sacks, one interception, and one blocked punt as a senior.
Fultondale, ALFultondale Stewart threw for 15 touchdowns and rushed for 29 touchdowns.
Huntsville, ALHuntsville Hill helped his team to a 7-5 record while reaching the second round of the playoffs.
Montgomery, ALCarver Johnson threw for 3,194 yards and 31 touchdowns against seven interceptions while adding 702 yards rushing and nine more scores.
Pinson Valley, ALPinson Valley Robinson caught 46 passes for 873 yards and 12 scores in 2012.
Prattville, ALPrattville Golson was the most consistent offensive player on a team that finished the season 5-5.
New Hope, ALNew Hope Ford rushed for 1,790 yards and 30 touchdowns during senior year.
Foley, ALFoley Helped his team to a 8-4 record and second round playoff berth.
Mobile, ALMcGill Toolen Smith threw for 1,521 yards and 19 touchdowns against five picks and rushed for 859 yards and 16 touchdowns during senior campaign.
Dothan, ALNorthview White guided his team to a 5-5 record while playing both ways.
Pinson, ALPinson Valley Cunningham amassed over 40 tackles for loss and four blocked punts in 2012.
Roanoke, ALHandley Bozeman suffered a season ending knee injury in September, his team finished 7-5.
Spanish Fort, ALSpanish Fort Led his team to a 14-1 record and state championship appearance.
Dothan, ALDothan Melton posted 64 tackles (41 solos and 23 assisted), two interceptions, one fumble recovery, eight pass breakups and returned a punt for a score.
Spanish Fort, ALSpanish Fort Johnson was a factor in the handful of games he played in, but missed most of the season because of off-the-field legal issues.
Auburn, ALAuburn Led his team to an 11-2 record and totaled over 1,800 all-purpose yards and 18 total touchdowns.
Huntsville, ALHuntsville Toney racked up 107 tackles, six tackles for loss, one forced fumble, one fumble recovery, and one interception in 2012.
Pinson, ALClay Woods helped his team score 36 points per game while going 12-2.
Daphne, ALBayside Academy Walton collected 122 tackles in his breakout senior campaign.
Dadeville, ALDadeville Crayton registered 157 tackles and four sacks to go with nine forced fumbles and five fumble recoveries.
Cottondale, ALPaul Bryant Missed five games with a foot injury during senior year after breakout junior season when he scored 17 touchdowns.
Fairhope, ALFairhope School Andrews lined up at quarterback and receiver this year and accounted for 1,903 yards of offense and 21 touchdowns.
Gadsden, ALGadsden City Hammond hauled in 15 passes for 306 yards and two touchdowns.
Oxford, ALOxford Jones collected 32 tackles, four tackles for loss, two sacks, one interception, and 22 pancake blocks on offense.
Phenix City, ALCentral Fraser was key factor in his team's 31.7 points per game output en route to a 7-4 record.
Prichard, ALBlount Bell led his team to a 6-5 mark and a first round playoff berth as a senior.
Jackson, ALJackson After leading his team to a state title as a junior, Johnson's squad went winless in district play.
Vestavia Hills, ALVestavia Hills Robinson helped his team to a 10-3 record including a playoff shutout win over Huntsville (Ala.).
Millbrook, ALStanhope Elmore Anderson's team yielded 17 points per game and finished with an 8-3 record.
Tuscaloosa, ALNorthridge Cox finished his senior year with 450 yards receiving and five scores while adding 24 tackles and two interceptions on defense.
Florence, ALFlorence Helped his team to a 7-5 mark and 6-1 record in district play.
Birmingham, ALWenonah Wilson hauled in close to 500 yards receiving and nine touchdowns while averaging a double-double on the hardwood.
Hoover, ALHoover His team won the Class 6A state championship, however he was removed from the team earlier in the season.
